115232111.content:
Luffy waved to the people of his quiet fishing village, winking at the ladies. Even from where he was on the open sea, Luffy could see several women swoon at his action, several others holding children of their own with rather large busts.

Something strange about this village was the fact that there were few men.

Not that Luffy had anything to do with that, or the children.

Nope, none at all.

Luffy chuckled, sitting down in his little dinghy and pulling his straw hat over his eyes. The women had insisted that they find a shipwright for him to build a ship, but Luffy was fine with this little boat. besides, he would probably commandeer a ship soon enough, out on the open seas.

"ROAAAAAUUUUUUUGH!"

Luffy flipped up the hat, smirking at the large beast.

It was a sea king, easily fifty feet long, three times as tall as him at the head, with teeth that could pierce him clean through.

No problem for him, Luffy D. Monkey, future king of the Pirates.

"My punch may not be as strong as a pistol quite yet, but I don't even need that to beat you." Luffy said, standing up in the boat, careful not to capsize it.

The Sea King roared again, lunging at Luffy's small boat.

Luffy grinned. This was exactly what he wanted.

He merely brought his arm back, as if he would punch the ferocious beast.

Only to Stab the poor beast in the nose!

With a syringe...

Made from his finger?

"Got you now." Luffy said, grinning. "Ero-Ero Rewrite!"

The sea-king, not really feeling the pin-pricks of the needles in it's nose, stopped in it's tracks. Something felt... off.

Then pain, indescribable pain.

The Sea-king thrashed about as it's body started shrinking, the beasts very DNA restructuring as it's body underwent an enormous physical, and mental, change.

Luffy sat back, watching his work unfold with a smirk on his face. 'Been wanting to do that for years.'

The Sea-kings body shrank, and shrank and shrank, all the way down to human sized. It grew arms, and legs, and lost its tail. Its skin smoothed, becoming less slippery and more soft, like a well oiled woman.

Speaking of woman, that's what it became.

Two large mounds of flesh sprung from the new chest of the creature. From the roaring, well, roar, it now had the sound of a young woman, though it was still a wild woman. Her teeth shrank down, becoming human-like, if just a tad more deadly then normal.

The mane the woman had sported as a Sea-King was still there, but it grew softer and more water repellent.

Once it was done, the woman floated there, looking very confused. She looked at her new hands, new legs, and tried to swim.

Needless to say, she failed miserably.

Luffy laughed a bit, rowing over to her. "Hey!"

The Sea-queen looked at Luffy, tilting her head in questioning.

"Ero-ero Pheromone mist!" He said, grinning A fine, golden mist surrounded Luffy, billowing away from him, covering the area in his Pheromones.

Even reaching back to his village. Several women came just from the smell.

Even the Sea-queen was effected by it. She looked at Luffy with big, black eyes, holding onto the side of his boat gently.

"Hey there beautiful." Luffy said, making the woman blush, for reasons unknown to her. "Would you mind doing me a huge favor?" He asked.

The Sea-queen nodded, barely understanding what he was saying. All she knew was that she hung on his every word, and it made her happy, with a need she never felt before.

Luffy tied a rope to his boat, tossing it in the water. "Mind towing this to the next Island?" He asked?

~Meanwhile Back on the Island~

In the forests and jungles all across the island, many humanoid animals were wishing Luffy well. Most all of them were female, and had a good grasp of the English language.

"We wish you luck Luffy!" A wolf woman howled to the sky.

"Go out there and show them who's king of the world!" A woman with bunny ears, whiskers and tail cried out, standing next to the wolf woman with no fear.

A big, strong looking woman stood, back against the trees, her belly heavy with children. She grinned a toothy grin. "Show em who's king of the jungle, you handsome beast you." She said, rubbing her belly.

Oh yes. Wether or not the world was ready, he was coming.

The God of Lust was here.

115332222222222222222222211.content:
The Principality of Zeon has declared its independence from the Earth Federation, and subsequently launched a massive war of independence, a war which has raged in every continent on earth and in nearly every space colony and lunar settlement. The Zeon have the upper hand through their use of a revolutionary new type of weapon, their humanoid like mobile suits. When a Zeon recon team disobey mission orders and begin attacking Side 7 its citizens stumble across the Federations latest weapon: the Gundam. With the aid of Earth Federation soldiers stationed aboard the MS carrier White Base the newly formed crew of refugees set out to change the course of the One Year War — or die trying.

At this time, We find the female officers on both sides going through... unique circumstances.
115332222222222222222222211.title: Universal Century 0079 Month September

1153322222222222222222222111.content: Do you want to see how the ladies of White Base are faring?
1153322222222222222222222111.title: Earth Federation ladies

1153322222222222222222222112.content:
Universal Century 0079: The Jungles of Southeast Asia. During the One Year War, the Earth Federation and the Principality of Zeon are fighting a brutal guerrilla war for control of the area and its resources. Zeon’s best hope for victory in the region rests with an experimental mobile armor, the Apsalus and its pilot, Aina Sahalin. Meanwhile the Earth Federal Army, which has been fighting the Zeon in the region, receive reinforcements in the form of Ensign Shiro Amada, newly named commander of the 08th MS Team. Aina and Shiro have met each other from a mutual rescue in space, but when Shiro discovers that Aina is in fact the pilot of the Zeon mobile armor he is arrested for treason. The Federation offers Shiro one chance at redemption: He must take the 08th MS Team deep into Zeon held territory to find Zeon’s hidden base. With the Zeon backed into a corner, and the Federation dependent on Shiro and his team for victory, the star crossed lovers must decide where their true allegiances lie: with each other, or with their respective sides.

It also seems that the ladies on the are gong through changes as well.
1153322222222222222222222112.title: Universal Century 0079 Month October

11533222222222222222222221122.content:
Zeon intelligence has identified a prototype Federation Gundam under development in a Federation base in the Arctic.The Cyclops Team, an elite Zeon MS commando team is dispatched to destroy the prototype, but before they can accomplish their mission the Gundam is launched into space. When the Gundam turns up in a Federation R&D base inside the neutral space colony Side 6, the Principality launches a covert operation to destroy the Gundam. When the raid fails, the Zeon prepares to launch a nuclear strike against the colony as punishment for siding with the Federation unless the last remaining commando can eliminate the Gundam.

0080: War in the Pocket

115332222222222222222222211222.content:
Zeon Intelligence has identified a prototype Gundam designed for nuclear attack under development by Anaheim Electronics. A former Zeon ace and a small band of Principality soldiers are dispatched to Earth to capture the Gundam as part of Operation Stardust. When the Zeon successfully make off with the prototype the Earth Federation assigns the mobile suit carrier Albion to locate and recover the missing unit. When the stolen Gundam fires at the space fortress Solomon (now occupied by the Federation Forces under the name of Konpei Island) the Federation Space Force suffers a catastrophic loss; as the Federation regroups, they learn that the Zeon have captured a space colony, Side 7, ostensibly with the objective of colliding it with the moon. When the colony's course is unexpectedly changed toward Earth, the true objective of Operation Stardust is revealed.

Can you make your memory into a new reality?
115332222222222222222222211222.title: Universal Century 0083

1153322222222222222222222112222.content:
Seven years after the end of the One Year War. After the events of Operation Stardust, the Earth Federation establishes an elite counter-insurgency division called the Titans to hunt down the remaining pockets of Zeon remnants. The Titans become overzealous in their mission, start resorting to brutal methods to achieve their goals, and become nothing more than ruthless tyrants with an ambition to rule the Earth Sphere. Two anti-Titans resistance groups, the AEUG (Anti-Earth Union Group) and their earth-bound counterparts Karaba (led by Mobile Suit Gundam's Hayato Kobayashi), form to unite the various existing small forces in the struggle against Titans.

Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam.
1153322222222222222222222112222.title: Universal Century 0087

Caught in a battle between the Titans and AEUG, they must somehow guide their ship through atmospheric entry. Luckily, they're not completely alone, as they find aid from a custom-painted Zeta Gundam, whose pilot sounds a lot like One Year War ace Amuro Ray.

115332222222222222222222211222222222.title: Universal Century 0123

1153322222222222222222222112222222222.content:
After the Cosmo Babylon Wars, Cosmo Babylonia collapses from civil conflicts after Cecily Fairchild denounces the nation's aristocratic ideals. However, new threats to peace began to surface in the UC130s, when it is discovered the Jupiter Empire is conspiring to invade and conquer the Earth Sphere. After staging her death to avoid attention from the Jupiter Empire, Cecily takes on her original name of "Berah Ronah" and re-establishes the Crossbone Vanguard, garnering public support in her war against the ruthless Jupiter Empire.

The remnants of the Crossbone Vanguard wage a secret war against the Jupiter Empire, which seeks to subject all humanity to the same totalitarian rule as the Jupiter Fleet's own people. This control is based on chronic resource scarcity, and the story develops into something of a critique of the space colonization concept, i.e. abandoning nature's abundance in favor of a cold, cruel existence in the inhospitable realm of outer space. Crossbone Gundam also advances a conspiracy theory to explain post-UC 0100 history. The Jupiter Empire, with its great wealth, provides funding and technology to anti-Federation groups in an attempt to hasten the government's collapse. They originally supported the Crossbone Vanguard, then turned on them after Berah Ronah took charge and renounced their aggressive ways.

At tale of Space Pirates and a fight for Humanity. What's not to enjoy?

1153322222222222222222222122222222212121.title: Before

1153322222222222222222222122222222212121.content:
Kousaka China looked to her left to see Sei Iori, a dear friend and Builder, focusing intently on the sketch in front of him, detailing the workings of his Gunpla, the Build Strike Gundam.
The sketch was very well done, but she was more concerned with Sei himself. He looked tired, exhausted even. Stress caused undoubtedly from late nights he worked on his Gunpla, making sure every last detail was right. If he kept up like this, he would make a mistake or worse...
She shook her head to clear those more dangerous thoughts, she believed Sei knew what he was doing and his partner Reiji would help when he could.
That is... IF he could. Reiji seemed rather clueless, headstrong, and stubborn, and he probably wouldn't notice till it was too late...
'Uwaaaahhh...' China thought in despair. 'How can I help Iori-kun when he's like this?'
Thinking back a bit, she remembered that she had hit a snag when building it, maybe if she asked Sei abou-
BRRRRRRRRRRRNG
She was jostled out of her thoughts by the end-of-day bell, and most of the class was leaving, Sei included, his head down is a tired daze, as though he himself was piloted by an outside force.

Does she follow him home? or does she go off he her own home?
1153322222222222222222222122222222212121.title: A worried friend.

choices: Rinko shows China the family album, showing a secret in plain sight.
Rinko gives China a small bottle of a unique potion.
1153322222222222222222222122222222212121.content:
China decided to follow Sei, mostly to make sure he went home safely, but a small part of her hoped to help him through this slump somehow.
The walk there was rather uneventful, but was to be expected in a small town. She kept her distance, so as not to gain attention from Sei, although in his current state she doubted it would matter, but still, she felt the best she could do was a silent cheer from afar, a shadow that would never be noti-
"Oi."
"Eyiiii!" China was startled by a voice to her side. Said voice was from an older boy with dark red wavy hair held partly back with a pair of blue shades, wearing white pants and a cream colored puff-shoulder shirt and a closed red vest with an upturned collar. On his right wrist was a gold band with a bluish-green gem on it. he was laying on a park bench near the playground. "R-Reiji-san?"
"You're that girl from that 'school' place Sei goes to... Kousaka, right?" Reiji asked as he got up and walked over to her. China nodded. "Whaddya doing here?"
"Um...well Iori-kun hasn't been looking very good, so..." she muttered out.
"Ah?" Reiji said in his normal bored tone before he looked down the ways and saw Sei walking in a lulled daze, his eyes hardened. "Geez, he looks like some of the captains back home after the monthly reviews."
Not taking in his comparison, China elaborated. "He's been pushing himself over your Gunpla. If he keeps going like this, he might -"
"So get him to relax, easy." Reiji cut her off for the third time, seriously, was this the gag here?
"You're his friend, Reiji-san. Can't you snap him out of it?"
Reiji sighed with a groan as he put his hands behind his head. "Over all this, I can't. I made an obligation and I have to see it to the end."
China looked surprised at this. He was obligated to help Sei?
"Sei wants to win with his Gunpla, and I'm helping his see that through. If I tell him to back off, he'll probably be broken up enough to never build Gunpla again; I've read about similar stuff that happened. That, and I really want to see the look on that Tatsuya's face when we wipe the floor with him."
China felt a bead of sweat drip down at that. Of course it would come down to the battle between the Build Strike and Yuki-sempai's Zaku Amazing. They could be such boys sometimes.
"So yeah, If I tell him to take it easy, it'll probably backfire." Reiji stated turning around and starting to walk away. "You might have better luck that I would."
China was surprised at this, Reiji was actually trusting her with helping Sei? "But what am I supposed to do?"
Reiji stopped and though for a moment. "Hmm... when my mom or dad were stressed with something, they simply went to bed and wrestled out their frustrations, I guess." Tell Sei's mom that I'll be back around dinnertime. Ja-ne!" He called as he walked off.

"Ohayo, China-chan." Rinko said with a smile. "what brings you out here?"
China smiled back, feeling a bit easier. "Ohayo, Iori-san. I came by to see how Iori-kun was doing, he didn't look very well at school."
Sighing, Rinko gained the expression she held previously. "You're right, I have only seen this happen to his father and it was so long ago that I can't remember how I pulled him back out of that slump."
"Perhaps it's not a matter of pulling out, but pushing in that is the problem he is facing." said a deep voice. In an adjacent aisle stood the heavyset man China met back at Sei, Reiji, and Yuki-sempai's match. His grayed bushy mustache ruffling as his lips curled into a gentle smile. "When a man pushes himself to the brink of exhaustion through failures, many times it simply takes one that cares about him unconditionally to guide him to his destiny."
"Once again, Ral-san, your insight is greatly appreciated." Rinko smiled at one of her best customers.
A light blush graced Mr. Ral's face. "Ah, thank you, Rinko-chan. That's very nice of you to say."
Rinko's face gained a devious smirk as she put her pinkie up. "and I believe your girlfriend would say the same thing, right?"
Mr. Ral gave a hearty laugh as a twinkle shone in his eye. "Indeed, Rinko-chan. There is no lost love between myself and Hamon-chan, no lost love."

Soon, Mr. Ral left with a new Gouf in hand, paid for, of course. Rinko turned her attention back to the young girl enamored with her son, a star in her eyes much like the two men in her life.
"China-chan?" she called.
"H-hai, Iori-san?" China stammered. Rinko giggled, she really was so cute!
"Why don't you help me with dinner?" the mother asked. "I'm sure both Sei and Reiji will enjoy it."

"Don't worry, don't worry. You can call him and tell him you'll be helping here and will be home later. He trusts you, right?"
"Well, I guess..."
"Perfect! let's get to it!" Rinko said as she pulled the young girl into the living area after she closed up the shop.

After a call to the Kousaka household with the OK from her father, China was happily working alongside Rinko making dinner.
"Ral-san was right, you know." Rinko said as China was washing the vegetables. "The closest one to a man's heart usually is the best to guide them."
"Oh... he was?" China stated monotonously, almost in silent embarrassment or self-pity.
Rinko was now worried about her, so she turned the stove down and looked at the girl. "China-chan, you like Sei a lot, don't you?" She asked in a warm motherly tone, China nodded. A warmer smile appeared on Rinko's face. "Come with me, I want to show you something."

12511221.content:
Minato wielded the Universe, standing defiantly in front of Nyx.

'Strange, that you seek to defy me, and your own kind with such adversity.' She said, only appearing as a pale moon to his eyes.

Minato looked at her, unblinking and without talking. He knew what he needed to do.

'Hmm?' The night queen mused, sounding genuinely confused. 'So you would give yourself to me willingly to save others? This is stranger then the last fact.'

The darkness around Minato swirled, trying to touch him and consume him, like so many others before him.

'Thanatos?' She asked, sensing her son in the man who stood against her. 'That is where you were, my wayward son. Come, speak with your mother.'

Minato held the blank, but all encompassing power of the universe in his hands, ready to unleash it's power to seal away the force behind the night queen. Yes, he could see it. The darkness that sought to consume him, consume all of humanity. It was pushing Nyx to kill all of humanity, bringing them all into the darkness with it for all eternity.

He could see those red eyes, watching from the darkness all around him, watching with a hunger unmatched for the souls of humanity.

He could See Erebus.

'Is that so?' Nyx said, talking to something Minato couldn't hear, or just didn't pay attention to. 'He would defy me to save others, but also willing to give himself to me to do the same. Strange, this human.'

"Minato!" A familier voice called from the Darkness, making Minato's eyes widen.

"Ryoji!" Minato said, surprised to see the avatar of death.

"Hey, sorry to interrupt your big hero moment sealing my dad away from my mom, but she would like to talk with you." He said, his yellow scarf fluttering in the vacuum.

Minato gaped, still holding the Universe in his hand. He stammered, before recomposing himself.

"I'm sorry... but what?"

Ryoji shook his head. "Dunno. She said you interest her. Mom always did like interesting things." He said with a sigh, shaking his head. "I suppose I should go say hi to everyone while I'm here. Man, won't they be surprised!"

"Uh..." Minato said, trying to find the words. "Didn't we just... fight you? On top of Tartarus?"

"Huh? Oh yeah, don't worry about it. I'm not mad at all. You guys were just doing what you had to do." He said, grabbing Minato's arm. "Now hurry. Mom really wants to meet you."

"Wait... Ryoji!" Minato said, feeling himself be pulled along through the endless darkness.

Except... it wasn't endless?

Minato found himself walking through a ivory and Onyx hallway, split evenly down the middle. On the left, there stood ivory. On the right, Onyx.

"Come on, don't stand there gawking." Ryoji said, pulling him along still as Minato was in awe of the stone work. It was seemless, the transition from white to black.

It also caused a headache, since every so often the hall would invert.

"You know, I just want to say, since I remember it all, sorry for killing your parents that night. I didn't really know what was going on, all I knew was that I hurt and that I was summoned. And I really didn't have human emotions at the time." He said. "And thanks for putting up with me for all those years, even as a monster and as the creepy kid Pharos. Popping in everywhere, cryptic messages. Ah, the good old days." He said, still pulling Minato along. "Oh, we're here."

Ryoji pulled Minato into a large, open room. It was tall, easily as tall as tartarus. The walls were black as night, thousands of lights shining from them like stars. The roof was made of Ivory, a stark contrast from the walls. It also seemed as if it were floating.

In this room, there was one piece of furniture. A fainting couch, not that Minato knew what it was called.

But it was who was on this absurdly large fainting couch that caught Minato's eye.

She was, literally, larger then life. A giantess. She wore robes that held the cosmos, the scene moving with each movement it took, like a sliding frame picture. She had dark hair, like the Onyx, and Ivory skin, almost blending into the background of her palace. She wore a black toga-like piece of cloth, leaving one of her breasts uncovered, which made Minato blush. She looked down on them, her eyes being as different as the sun and the moon.

Wait... Minato looked closer...

Holy shit they were the sun and moon.

She had the sun and the moon for eyes!

Well, that made sense given the appearance of the moon before he ascended to fight her.

Well, this made him feel slightly under-equipped now.

"Hi Mom!" Ryoji said, waving at her like nothing was out of the ordinary.

'Hello sweetie.' She said with a small smile, but never moving her lips otherwise. 'Have you seen your brother around? He's been gone almost as long as you have.'

"Um, no. I can't say I have. I think he may have fallen asleep on the way back from wherever he was." Ryoji said.

'Would you be a dear and go look for him?' She asked, stretching as she turned her focus solely on Minato. 'I wish to talk with this human alone.'

"You got it mom! Later Minato." He said, strolling back past Minato, leaving him alone with this giantess of a goddess.

'Hello, human.' Nyx said, not beating around the bush as soon as Ryoji was gone. 'I must admit that you are quite the looker, if a tad scrawny.' She said with a laugh.

She stood up, towering over Minato. Then she was in front of him, standing a few inches taller then him. She was in his face, inspecting him, regarding him with her moon/sun eye combo.

'Interesting. Yes, I can sense the potential in you. Very powerful. Strong enough to wield the universe even.' She said, looking at the blank card in his hand. 'Even more interesting. Even capable of using a persona of the universe, mixed with power of the fool. Limitless potential, with limitless power, and you would only seal Erebus away? Nay, human. You could bind Erebus so that he could not contact me in any way, shape or form. That would keep me from sending my son to kill humanity, if that was your desire.'

"But why do what it tells you?" Minato blurted out, slapping a hand over his mouth a moment later.

Nyx smiled sadly, not upset with Minato's outburst it seemed. 'Because he is my husband. He may not seem like it, but Erebus was once a nice god. But when men feasted upon the fruit of knowledge, he was reduced to what he is now. A black pit that seeks to consume all of humanity in despair.' She said, standing back up. 'Ever since, he has been trapped in the sea of souls, floundering in its depths to stay away from the light of life. I had thought to be able to save him, but I know I delude myself.'

She moved back, looking up. 'But even still. He is my husband, and I love him dearly. But... perhaps it is time to let him go. How long has it been since he has been reduced to the mindless beast he is now?' She asked in wonder, a tear escaping her moon eye.

She sniffled, before smiling sadly at Minato again. 'And that is where you come in, Human...Minato.' She said, moving closer to him. 'I think it is time I gave my husband up for lost and remarry. However, due to humanity turning what few gods remain into either persona or into beings like Erebus, it would not be wise to search for a husband in my realm of existence. But you are a special case, with that power you wield. A mortal with the power of a god. Something like that happens once every universe life-span, if one is lucky.' She said.

She wrapped her arms around Minato, pulling his head to her chest, making him blush even more.

Remember. One. Exposed. Breast.

'So, I think you would be the right person for me. You are of stronger will then I, and are willing to defy me. You would be perfect to be the new king of the heavens, and I would cherish you forever and always. I would be more then willing to help you and your... associates in defending humanity if you wished. Do not think that I am the only one with the ability to conjure shadows. My son may be the perfect shadow, or was the perfect shadow at one point, there are other gods who wish death upon humanity. And best of all, you wouldn't have to sacrifice yourself to seal Erebus away. I would help you, along with my sons and daughters. Just agree to be mine.'

The way she said the last sentence sounded more like a physical need then anything else. It was almost frightening, hearing that tone. It was like she absolutely needed someone to lavish attention on, someone to love.

But honestly, how could Minato refuse? All his life he had helped people. Nyx really was no different.

Besides, could it be all that bad? This meant he could see his friends again after all.

"I..." Was he really going to do this? "I..." Nyx seemed to hang on his every word. "I acc..." There was no turning back after this.

"I accept." Minato said, only to have Nyx crashing her lips into his the next second as the Universe flared to life in his hand.

~In the darkness

Erebus clawed at Nyx's dimension, trying to push her towards killing humanity. It didn't know why, but Nyx listened to him, so it used that to the advantage it could even figure out.

'Killkillkillkillkillkillkillkill...' Was all that ran through its head, trying to push Nyx to kill them all.

A light blasted towards it, causing it pain just by the mere presence alone. It blasted it back, shredding the shadow's away, revealing nothing but bone underneath. The light wrapped around, like chains, making it scream in agony and anger, not able to move even the slightest.

Many figures stood around Erebus, pulling the chains taught. The children he had sired, even Ryoji and Hypnos.

"Good work Minato." The avatar of death said. "Or should I say... Dad?"

She tried to see if anyone else was around when she heard the sound of an argument.
"What were you thinking? Bringing in someone like this, it'll only be a matter of time before we're discovered!" she heard a distressed man say. there was a bit of scuffling, then a second voice replied.
"Then I suppose we will need to work quickly then, Doctor." the voice was more gravely than the former, almost... hissing when he spoke.
"No... something like this... I learned from my mistakes concerning you."
"Misstakes? Oh Doctor, you are too hard on yourself. Think of the... benefits the world will see."
"I see the benefits when I look in the mirror." the first man growled, only to be met with a hissing snarl.
"Don't think that I'm some lab accident, Doctor. You knew those risks and went through with it anyway."
"But you remember what happened with those Cross-Species. You know what happened!"
'Cross-Species?' Mary Jane thought, 'That craziness that happened a couple months ago?' These two were involved in that? she had to get out of there, FAST!
"Failures from a lesser mind. Even you can understand that." the second man said before he paused a moment. "Ah, it seems our guest has woken up."

The man chuckled with a hiss in his voice. "My apologies, my dear, I haven't introduced myself yet. I am Dr. Curtis Connors, but you probably know us as -"
"The Lizard. I know." Mary Jane said with a glare.
He was tall man with green scaled skin wearing a lab coat, he was wearing glasses with a band across the back of his head to make sure they didn't fall off. A long tail coiled behind him. The Lizard's wide mouth grinned, showing pointed teeth.
"Oh? A bit of hostility, and not out of fear. Curious, care to tell me why?" the Lizard asked in his gravely voice.
"You killed the chief of police, my best friend Gwen's father." Mary Jane snarled.
The Lizard's expression turned to shock, he suddenly gripped his head with his left arm as his right fell dead to his side. he writhed about for a few moments before he looked back at his captive, a more regretful expression in his eyes.
"It was an accident," the Lizard said in the distressed voice from earlier. This was the man from the conversation before, This was the real Curt Connors! "I had no control over any of it- GRRRRRR!!!" The Lizard flailed again, his right arm gripping his head along with the left. He shuddered before he looked back at Mary Jane, the cold calculating predator reflected in his eyes.

-"Do you think she knows about Parker?"- Connors asked.
-"I doubt it, Gwen would keep that secret of her mate."- the Lizard thought. -"Although, with this development, I doubt his secret will be one for long."-

-"Call it animal instinct or whatever you want, but don't you think this girl and Gwen feel similar?"- the Lizard queried as he placed another vial's contents into the bubbling vial.

-"The Spider is strong, Connors. We can both attest to that."- the Lizard assured. -"If this works, not only will our life be easier, but perhaps this would be our way of thanking him."-
Curtis, through the Lizard's face, expressed surprise at the idea. -"Since when were you this smart and cunning?"-
-"I'm you, remember?"- the Lizard replied, a smirk across his wide mouth. He placed the contents of the bubbling vial into a cooled vial, then placing letter vial into a centrifuge. Turning it on, he turned his attention back to the captive redhead. She continued to glare at the scaled visage.
"What do you mean 'fixing'?" she asked vehemently. "All I've heard about is you tearing up most of Manhattan." She continued writhing against the ropes in desperation.
The Lizard chuckled as his right arm fell to his side, showing that Dr. Connors was in control. "That was the initial reaction to the procedure. Introducing an animal's DNA strain into someone's body causes the body to react by the instinct taken from the animal. It's best surmised by considering a fish's mind within a bird's body. It's not natural, so it reacts by panicking and lashing out at everything." Connors's right arm moved in an arc, showing the Lizard was dominant now.
